STATE OF MICHIGAN

GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 22, 2025
Michelle Zalewski
Samaritas- Refugee
1545 Keystone Ave.,
Lansing, MI, 48911-4039
RE: License#: CB330201264
Dear Ms. Zalewski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/19/25. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the WOC area manager Shay Mavis at (269) 243-2725.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Foster Home Reevaluation- Regarding interviews of all household members
during reevaluation, if a child is new to the home, refuses, or is unable to
provide certain information, the attempt should be documented in the report.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator (CA) Assessment dated 8/18/25 was reviewed and
discussed on-site. The CA reported there were no violations during the 2024
review. Therefore, they did not have a corrective action plan to follow. However,
the agency continues to internally monitor their compliance with licensing rules.

One tool they use is monitoring Key Performance Indicators (KPI). The agency
reported they have maintained high KPIs over the past year.
The CA reported some challenges over the past year include delays with Medicaid
being activated by MDHHS, and difficulty scheduling medical and dental
appointments due to Medicaid not being activated. The CA reported they have
also had challenges due to staffing shortages over the past year. The CA reported
addressing these challenges through monthly supervision, bi-weekly
Unaccompanied Refugee Minor staff meetings, and meetings with the quality
improvement team. Through these meetings, staff have been able to address
barriers in an ongoing manner and meet time frames.
The CA reported there were no unplanned removals during this review period.
Financial Overview
Based on review of the agency's 2025 budget and 2023 financial audit, no
financial concerns were found. The agency's 2024 financial audit is in progress.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on site. One staff had been with the agency for over a
year; the other had been with the agency for three months. Both staff stated they
enjoyed their jobs and felt the workload was manageable. Both staff stated they
received support from their co-workers and supervisor. Staff stated their
supervisor was helpful, knowledgeable, supportive, and available. Overall, they
described the environment as supportive. Neither staff had any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as the 2024
review. There is adequate office and meeting space for staff and clients. The
facility had sufficient locking storage for case files and confidential information.
VII. AGENCY ANALYST FINDINGS
This is a non-contracted agency.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
_ ____________August 22, 2025________________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 22, 2025
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
Area Manager
